feed.title: Rigzone.com: Latest News Headlines
feed.description: The latest oil and gas news from around the world.

items.title: Permian Methane Emissions Dropped 85 Percent in Last Decade: Study
items.description: Methane emission intensity in the Permian Basin dropped between 2011 and 2022, despite total oil and gas production increasing by over 416 percent.
items.content: Methane emission intensity in the Permian Basin dropped between 2011 and 2022, despite total oil and gas production increasing by over 416 percent.

items.title: Russian LNG Project Starts Production Despite U.S. Sanctions
items.description: Russia's biggest liquefied natural gas producer began production at its Arctic LNG 2 project despite U.S. sanctions.
items.content: Russia's biggest liquefied natural gas producer began production at its Arctic LNG 2 project despite U.S. sanctions.

items.title: Orlen to Swap Norway Upstream Assets with Wintershall
items.description: PUN will transfer a minor part of its interest in the the Ærfugl Nord field to Wintershall Dea for an interest in the Idun Nord field.
items.content: PUN will transfer a minor part of its interest in the the Ærfugl Nord field to Wintershall Dea for an interest in the Idun Nord field.

items.title: Azule Energy Inks Contracts for 3 Angola Blocks
items.description: Azule Energy has signed risk service contracts (RSCs) for several blocks in Angola's Lower Congo Basin.
items.content: Azule Energy has signed risk service contracts (RSCs) for several blocks in Angola's Lower Congo Basin.

items.title: Petronas Inks MoU, Two TAAs with PTTEP for Sarawak Blocks
items.description: The MoU and the TAAs are in relation to the development of PTTEP-operated blocks SK405B and SK410B.
items.content: The MoU and the TAAs are in relation to the development of PTTEP-operated blocks SK405B and SK410B.

items.title: Indian Refiners Seek to Stockpile MidEast Crude amid Red Sea Attacks
items.description: Indian refiners hope to avoid the risk of longer shipping time and higher costs following recent attacks on ships in the Red Sea.
items.content: Indian refiners hope to avoid the risk of longer shipping time and higher costs following recent attacks on ships in the Red Sea.

items.title: NG Energy's Colombian Gas Reserves Up Four Times Year-on-Year
items.description: In Colombia this year NG Energy drilled a new well and signed a deal to develop pipeline infrastructure.
items.content: In Colombia this year NG Energy drilled a new well and signed a deal to develop pipeline infrastructure.

items.title: Hitachi, Petrofac Get 2nd Contract under $14B TenneT Power Agreement
items.description: TenneT awarded the second project under an agreement to expand wind power generation on the Netherlands' side of the North Sea.
items.content: TenneT awarded the second project under an agreement to expand wind power generation on the Netherlands' side of the North Sea.

items.title: Oil Falls from One Month High Amid Thin Holiday Trading
items.description: Oil retreated from its highest close in almost a month as key technical gauges flashed weakness amid thin holiday trading.
items.content: Oil retreated from its highest close in almost a month as key technical gauges flashed weakness amid thin holiday trading.

items.title: Block Energy Eyes Farm-Out of Georgia Asset
items.description: Block has designed a multi-stage appraisal and development plan that is being used to facilitate discussions with possible partners.
items.content: Block has designed a multi-stage appraisal and development plan that is being used to facilitate discussions with possible partners.
